100.name: Computational Thinking
100.description: Meaning and impact of computational thinking. Solving problems using computational thinking, testing, debugging. How computers work. No prior computing experience required. Not for students with existing credit for or exemption from CPSC 107, CPSC 110 or APSC 160.

103.name: Introduction to Systematic Program Design
103.description: Computation as a tool for systematic problem solving in non-computer-science disciplines. Introductory programming skills. Not for credit for students who have credit for, or exemption from, or are concurrently taking CPSC 110 or APSC 160. No programming experience expected.

107.name: Systematic Program Design
107.description: Fundamental computation and program structures. Continuing systematic program design from CPSC 103.

110.name: Computation, Programs, and Programming
110.description: Fundamental program and computation structures. Introductory programming skills. Computation as a tool for information processing, simulation and modelling, and interacting with the world.

121.name: Models of Computation
121.description: Physical and mathematical structures of computation.  Boolean algebra and combinations logic circuits; proof techniques; functions and sequential circuits; sets and relations; finite state machines; sequential instruction execution.

203.name: Programming, Problem Solving, and Algorithms
203.description: Analysis of increasingly complex algorithmic problems, using a modern programming language and a variety of approaches. Problem decomposition and abstraction guide explorations of topics from applied algorithms, for example Voronoi Diagrams, Markov Chains, Bin Packing, and Graph Search. Not for students with credit for, or currently enrolled in, CPSC 210 or CPEN 221.
203.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 103, CPSC 110, APSC 160, EOSC 211, MATH 210, PHYS 210, COMM 337.

210.name: Software Construction
210.description: Design, development, and analysis of robust software components. Topics such as software design, computational models, data structures, debugging, and testing.

213.name: Introduction to Computer Systems
213.description: Software architecture, operating systems, and I/O architectures.  Relationships between application software, operating systems, and computing hardware; critical sections, deadlock avoidance, and performance; principles and operation of disks and networks.

221.name: Basic Algorithms and Data Structures
221.description: Design and analysis of basic algorithms and data structures; algorithm analysis methods, searching and sorting algorithms, basic data structures, graphs and concurrency.
221.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 210, CPEN 221 and either (a) one of CPSC 121, MATH 220 or (b) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 226.

259.name: Data Structures and Algorithms for Electrical Engineers
259.description: Advanced procedural programming.  Fundamental algorithms for sorting and searching.  Data structures including lists, trees, and hash tables.  Introduction to scripting languages and file input/output.

298.name: Co-operative Work Placement I
298.description: Approved and supervised technical work experience in the computing industry for a minimum of 3.5 months. Normally taken during Winter Session of second year. Technical report required. Restricted to students admitted to the Co-operative Education Program in Computer Science.

302.name: Numerical Computation for Algebraic Problems
302.description: Numerical techniques for basic mathematical processes involving no discretization, and their analysis. Solution of linear systems, including analysis of round-off errors; norms and condition number; introduction to iterative techniques in linear algebra, including eigenvalue problems; solution to nonlinear equations.
302.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 103, CPSC 110, CPEN 221, EOSC 211, PHYS 210 and one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

303.name: Numerical Approximation and Discretization
303.description: Numerical techniques for basic mathematical processes involving discretization, and their analysis. Interpolation and approximation, including splines and least squares data fitting; numerical differentiation and integration; introduction to numerical initial value ordinary differential equations.
303.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 103, CPSC 110, CPEN 221, EOSC 211, PHYS 210 and one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

304.name: Introduction to Relational Databases
304.description: Overview of database systems, ER models, logical database design and normalization, formal relational query languages, SQL and other commercial languages,data warehouses, special topics.

310.name: Introduction to Software Engineering
310.description: Specification, design, validation, evolution and construction of modern software systems, within the context of socially and professionally relevant domains such as ethics, intellectual property, and information security.

311.name: Definition of Programming Languages
311.description: Comparative study of advanced programming language features. Statement types, data types, variable binding, parameter passing mechanisms. Methods for syntactic and semantic description of programming languages.

312.name: Functional and Logic Programming
312.description: Principles of symbolic computing, using languages based upon first-order logic and the lambda calculus. Algorithms for implementing such languages. Applications to artificial intelligence and knowledge representation.

313.name: Computer Hardware and Operating Systems
313.description: Instruction sets, pipelining, code optimization, caching, virtual memory management, dynamically linked libraries, exception processing, execution time of programs.

314.name: Computer Graphics
314.description: Human vision and colour; geometric transformations; algorithms for 2-D and 3-D graphics; hardware and system architectures; shading and lighting; animation.
314.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPSC 221 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

317.name: Introduction to Computer Networking
317.description: Computer networking, basic communication protocols, network infrastructure and routing.  Common application-level protocols and principles associated with developing distributed applications.

319.name: Software Engineering Project
319.description: The design, implementation, and test of a large software system, using a team approach.

320.name: Intermediate Algorithm Design and Analysis
320.description: Systematic study of basic concepts and techniques in the design and analysis of algorithms, illustrated from various problem areas. Topics include: models of computation; choice of data structures; graph-theoretic, algebraic, and text processing algorithms.
320.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPSC 221. (and at least 3 credits from COMM 291, BIOL 300, MATH or STAT at 200 level or above.)

322.name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
322.description: Problem-solving and planning; state/action models and graph searching. Natural language understanding Computational vision. Applications of artificial intelligence.

330.name: Applied Machine Learning
330.description: Application of machine learning tools, with an emphasis on solving practical problems. Data cleaning, feature extraction, supervised and unsupervised machine learning, reproducible workflows, and communicating results.
330.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) one of CPSC 203, CPSC 210, CPEN 221 or (b) MATH 210 and one of CPSC 107, CPSC 110.

340.name: Machine Learning and Data Mining
340.description: Models of algorithms for dimensionality reduction, nonlinear regression, classification, clustering and unsupervised learning; applications to computer graphics, computer games, bio-informatics, information retrieval, e-commerce, databases, computer vision and artificial intelligence.
340.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPSC 221 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and one of STAT 241, STAT 251, ECON 325, ECON 327, MATH 302, STAT 302, MATH 318.

344.name: Introduction to Human Computer Interaction Methods
344.description: Basic tools and techniques, teaching a systematic approach to interface design, task analysis, analytic and empirical evaluation methods.

349.name: Honours Research Seminar
349.description: Students will attend a series of research seminars presented by faculty members, produce a thesis proposal, and choose their honours thesis supervisor. Available to Honours students. Majors students with satisfactory standing may also be permitted to enrol.

368.name: Databases in Data Science
368.description: Overview of relational and non-relational database systems, role and usage of a database when querying data, data modelling, query languages, and query optimization.
368.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 203, CPSC 210, CPEN 221.

404.name: Advanced Relational Databases
404.description: Physical database design, indexing, external mergesort, relational query processing and optimization, transaction processing, concurrency control, crash recovery, special topics.
404.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPSC 304 and one of CPSC 213, CPSC 261, CPEN 212.

406.name: Computational Optimization
406.description: Formulation and analysis of algorithms for continuous and discrete optimization problems; linear, nonlinear, network, dynamic, and integer optimization; large-scale problems; software packages and their implementation; duality theory and sensitivity.
406.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 302, CPSC 303, MATH 307.

410.name: Advanced Software Engineering
410.description: Specification, design, construction and validation of multi-version software systems.
410.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     Either (a) CPSC 310 or (b) all of CPEN 321, CPEN 331.

416.name: Distributed Systems
416.description: Concepts and design of distributed systems. Communication architecture and models for interprocess communication. Process migration, naming, distributed file systems, fault tolerance, and concurrency control.
416.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     One of CPSC 313, CPEN 331 and one of CPSC 317, ELEC 331.

418.name: Parallel Computation
418.description: Algorithms, architectures, and programming paradigms for parallel computation.  Shared memory, message passing, and data parallel architectures and programming models.  Parallel algorithms including reduce, scan, and sorting networks.  Reasoning about the correctness of parallel programs.  Performance analysis and measurement for parallel programs.
418.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPSC 320 and one of CPSC 261, CPSC 313, CPEN 212, CPEN 411.

420.name: Advanced Algorithms Design and Analysis
420.description: The study of advanced topics in the design and analysis of algorithms and associated data structures. Topics include algorithms for graph-theoretic; algebraic and geometric problems; algorithms on nonsequential models; complexity issues; approximation algorithms.

421.name: Introduction to Theory of Computing
421.description: Characterizations of computability (using machines, languages and functions). Universality, equivalence and Church's thesis. Unsolvable problems. Restricted models of computation. Finite automata, grammars and formal languages.

422.name: Intelligent Systems
422.description: Principles and techniques underlying the design, implementation and evaluation of intelligent computational systems. Applications of artificial intelligence to natural language understanding, image understanding and computer-based expert and advisor systems. Advanced symbolic programming methodology.

425.name: Computer Vision
425.description: Introduction to the processing and interpretation of images.  Image sensing, sampling, and filtering.  Algorithms for colour analysis, texture description, stereo imaging, motion interpretation, 3D shape recovery, and recognition.
425.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     All of CPSC 221, MATH 200, MATH 221.

427.name: Video Game Programming
427.description: Video game programming techniques and technologies, including rendering, animation, interaction, game AI, real-time software development for games; start-to-finish simple video-game design and implementation.
427.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPSC 221 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.

430.name: Computers and Society
430.description: Impact of computer technology on society; historical perspectives; social and economic consequences of large-scale information processing systems and automatic control; legal and ethical problems in computer applications. Computers and the individual: machine versus human capabilities, fact and fancy; problematic interface between man and machine.
430.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (3 credits of Computer Science and at least third-year standing.)

436A.name: Topics in Computer Science - OS DESIGN & IMPL
436A.description: Selected topics in a specific area within Computer Science. May be taken more than once for credit with permission of the department.
436A.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Third-year standing in a Computer Science or Computer Engineering specialization, and permission of the department.)

436C.name: Topics in Computer Science - CLOUD COMPUTING
436C.description: Selected topics in a specific area within Computer Science. May be taken more than once for credit with permission of the department.
436C.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Third-year standing in a Computer Science or Computer Engineering specialization, and permission of the department.)

436E.name: Topics in Computer Science - ENTREPRENEURSHIP
436E.description: Selected topics in a specific area within Computer Science. May be taken more than once for credit with permission of the department.
436E.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Third-year standing in a Computer Science or Computer Engineering specialization, and permission of the department.)

436N.name: Topics in Computer Science - NLP
436N.description: Selected topics in a specific area within Computer Science. May be taken more than once for credit with permission of the department.
436N.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Third-year standing in a Computer Science or Computer Engineering specialization, and permission of the department.)

436R.name: Topics in Computer Science - RANDOMIZED ALGS
436R.description: Selected topics in a specific area within Computer Science. May be taken more than once for credit with permission of the department.
436R.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Third-year standing in a Computer Science or Computer Engineering specialization, and permission of the department.)

436S.name: Topics in Computer Science - COMP SECURITY
436S.description: Selected topics in a specific area within Computer Science. May be taken more than once for credit with permission of the department.
436S.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:      (Third-year standing in a Computer Science or Computer Engineering specialization, and permission of the department.)

440.name: Advanced Machine Learning
440.description: Advanced machine learning techniques focusing on probabilistic models. Deep learning and differentiable programming, exponential families and Bayesian inference, probabilistic graphical models and other generative models, Monte Carlo and variational inference methods.

444.name: Advanced Methods for Human Computer Interaction
444.description: Design and evaluation methodologies and theories; formal models of the user including visual, motor, and information processing; advanced evaluation methods including laboratory experiments and field studies; HCI research frontiers.
444.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     CPSC 344 and one of STAT 200, STAT 201, STAT 203, STAT 241, STAT 251, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, GEOG 374, KIN  206, KIN  371, POLI 380, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366, SOCI 328.

447.name: Introduction to Visualization
447.description: Design and implementation of static and interactive visualizations. Selection of appropriate visualization methods for given combinations of data type and intended analysis task. Assessment of visual representations according to design and perceptual principles.

448A.name: Directed Studies in Computer Science - DIRECTED STUDIES
448A.description: Open ordinarily to students in Computer Science with at least a 72% average and permission of the department.  The course may consist of supervised reading, participation in a seminar, and one or more programming projects.

448B.name: Directed Studies in Computer Science - DIRECTED STUDIES
448B.description: Open ordinarily to students in Computer Science with at least a 72% average and permission of the department.  The course may consist of supervised reading, participation in a seminar, and one or more programming projects.

448C.name: Directed Studies in Computer Science - DIRECTED STUDIES
448C.description: Open ordinarily to students in Computer Science with at least a 72% average and permission of the department.  The course may consist of supervised reading, participation in a seminar, and one or more programming projects.

449.name: Honours Thesis
449.description: Under supervision of a faculty member, students investigate a research topic and prepare a thesis.

491.name: Interactive Digital Media Practicum
491.description: Design and implementation of interactive digital media systems using modern processes and tools. Projects provided by external clients or vetted entrepreneurial pitches are developed by interdisciplinary teams composed of one CPSC 491 student and multiple Master of Digital Media students.
491.pre_req_raw: Pre-reqs:     All of CPSC 221, CPSC 310, CPSC 344. (and Third-year standing.)

501.name: Theory of Automata, Formal Languages and Computability

532D.name: Topics in Artificial Intelligence - STAT LEARN THRY

536M.name: Topics in Algorithms and Complexity - OPTIM THEORY

536S.name: Topics in Algorithms and Complexity - SUBMODULAR OPT
